00029 from PyQt4.QtCore import *
00030 from PyQt4.QtGui import *
00031 from Koo.KooChart import *
00032 
00033 import datetime 
00034 import time
00035 import locale
00036 
00037 DT_FORMAT = '%Y-%m-%d'
00038 DHM_FORMAT = '%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'
00039 HM_FORMAT = '%H:%M:%S'
00040 
00041 if not hasattr(locale, 'nl_langinfo'):
00042         locale.nl_langinfo = lambda *a: '%x'
00043 
00044 if not hasattr(locale, 'D_FMT'):
00045         locale.D_FMT = None
00046 
00047 
00048 class ChartGraphicsView( QGraphicsView ):
00049         def __init__(self, parent=None):
00050                 QGraphicsView.__init__(self, parent)
00051                 self.setRenderHints( QPainter.Antialiasing | QPainter.TextAntialiasing | QPainter.SmoothPixmapTransform )
00052                 self.scene = QGraphicsScene(self)
00053                 self.setScene( self.scene )
00054                 self.chart = None
00055 
00056         def setModel(self, model):
00057                 self._model = model
00058 
00059         def setFields(self, fields):
00060                 self._fields = fields
00061 
00062         def setType(self, type):
00063                 self._type = type
00064 
00065         def setAxis(self, axis):
00066                 self._axis = axis
00067 
00068         def setGroups(self, groups):
00069                 self._groups = groups
00070 
00071         def setAxisData(self, axisData):
00072                 self._axisData = axisData
00073 
00074         def setAxisGroupField(self, axisGroupField):
00075                 self._axisGroupField = axisGroupField
00076 
00077         def setOrientation(self, orientation):
00078                 self._orientation = orientation
00079 
00080         def resizeEvent(self, event):
00081                 if self.chart:
00082                         self.chart.setSize( QSize( self.size().width() - 100, self.size().height() - 100 ) )
00083 
00084         def display(self, models):
00085                 self._models = models
00086                 if not self.chart:
00087                         if self._type == 'pie': 
00088                                 self.chart = GraphicsPieChartItem()
00089                         else:
00090                                 self.chart = GraphicsBarChartItem()
00091                                 if self._orientation == Qt.Horizontal:
00092                                         self.chart.setAggregated( True )
00093                         self.chart.setSize( self.size() )
00094                         self.scene.addItem( self.chart )
00095 
00096                 # Put all values to be shown in the records list
00097                 records = []
00098 
00099                 # Models could be None
00100                 if models:
00101                         # Fill in records with data from all models for all necessary fields.
00102                         # records will be a list of dictionaries:
00103                         # records = [
00104                         #       { 'field1': value, 'field2': value }, #record 1
00105                         #       { 'field1': value, 'field2': value }  #record 2
00106                         #       ...
00107                         # }
00108                         for m in models:
00109                                 res = {}
00110                                 for x in self._axisData.keys():
00111                                         type = self._fields[x]['type']
00112                                         if type in ('many2one', 'char','time','text'):
00113                                                 res[x] = m.value(x) 
00114                                         elif type == 'selection':
00115                                                 res[x] = ''
00116                                                 for y in self._fields[x]['selection']:
00117                                                         if y[0] == m.value(x):
00118                                                                 res[x] = unicode(y[1])
00119                                                                 break
00120                                         elif type == 'date':
00121                                                 date = time.strptime(m.value(x), DT_FORMAT)
00122                                                 res[x] = time.strftime(locale.nl_langinfo(locale.D_FMT).replace('%y', '%Y'), date)
00123                                         elif type == 'datetime':
00124                                                 date = time.strptime(m.value(x), DHM_FORMAT)
00125                                                 if 'tz' in Rpc.session.context:
00126                                                         try:
00127                                                                 import pytz
00128                                                                 lzone = pytz.timezone(Rpc.session.context['tz'])
00129                                                                 szone = pytz.timezone(Rpc.session.timezone)
00130                                                                 dt = datetime.datetime(date[0], date[1], date[2], date[3], date[4], date[5], date[6])
00131                                                                 sdt = szone.localize(dt, is_dst=True)
00132                                                                 ldt = sdt.astimezone(lzone)
00133                                                                 date = ldt.timetuple()
00134                                                         except:
00135                                                                 pass
00136                                                 res[x] = time.strftime(locale.nl_langinfo(locale.D_FMT).replace('%y', '%Y')+' %H:%M:%S', date)
00137                                         else:
00138                                                 res[x] = float(m.value(x))
00139                                 records.append(res)
00140 
00141                 # Calculate the rest of values
00142                 operators = {
00143                         '+': lambda x,y: x+y,
00144                         '*': lambda x,y: x*y,
00145                         'min': lambda x,y: min(x,y),
00146                         'max': lambda x,y: max(x,y),
00147                         '**': lambda x,y: x**y
00148                 }
00149                 # Fill in aggRecords (aggregated records). So it basically aggregates records
00150                 # appropiately. For example, a view may be defined:
00151                 #
00152                 # <graph string="Timesheet by user" type="bar">
00153                 #     <field name="name"/>
00154                 #     <field name="quantity" operator="+"/>
00155                 #     <field group="True" name="user_id"/>
00156                 # </graph>
00157                 #
00158                 # So here we "execute" the operator="+" attribute. And the group tag.
00159                 aggRecords = []
00160                 groups = {}
00161                 for field in self._axis[1:]:
00162                         data = {}
00163                         for d in records:
00164                                 data.setdefault( d[self._axis[0]], {} )
00165 
00166                                 groupEval = ','.join( [d[x] for x in self._groups] )
00167                                 groups[groupEval] = 1
00168 
00169                                 if groupEval in data[d[self._axis[0]]]:
00170                                         oper = operators[self._axisData[field].get('operator', '+')]
00171                                         data[d[self._axis[0]]][groupEval] = oper(data[d[self._axis[0]]][groupEval], d[field])
00172                                 else:
00173                                         data[d[self._axis[0]]][groupEval] = d[field]
00174                         aggRecords.append(data)
00175                 groups = groups.keys()
00176                 groups.sort()
00177 
00178                 fields = set()
00179                 for field in self._axis[1:]:
00180                         fields.add( self._fields[field]['name'] )
00181                 fields = list(fields)
00182                 fields.sort()
00183 
00184                 labels = [self._fields[x]['string'] for x in self._axis[1:]]
00185 
00186                 categories = set()
00187                 for x in records:
00188                         categories.add( x[ self._axis[0] ] )
00189                 categories = list(categories)
00190                 categories.sort()
00191 
00192                 if self._type == 'pie': 
00193                         categories = data.keys()
00194                         values = [ reduce(lambda x,y=0: x+y, data[x].values(), 0) for x in categories ]
00195                         self.chart.setValues( values ) 
00196                         # Ensure all categories are strings
00197                         self.chart.setLabels( [unicode(x) for x in categories] )
00198                 else:
00199                         # Prepare values depending in different ways if there are 'group' tags in the
00200                         # view or not.
00201                         if groups and groups[0]:
00202                                 # GTK client leaves only the last part with the following line:
00203                                 #    groups = [x.split('/')[-1] for x in groups]
00204                                 # However that may remove important information. For example, in product types:
00205                                 #   'Class A / Subclass A' -> 'Subclass A'
00206                                 #   'Class B / Subclass A' -> 'Subclass A'
00207                                 values = []
00208                                 for x in categories:
00209                                         value = []
00210                                         for y in groups:
00211                                                 for z in aggRecords:
00212                                                         value.append( z[ x ].get(y, 0.0) )
00213                                         values.append( value )  
00214                                 # If we're grouping we need to change the labels
00215                                 labels = groups
00216                         else:
00217                                 values = []
00218                                 for x in categories:
00219                                         value = []
00220                                         for y in aggRecords:
00221                                                 value.append( y[ x ][''] )
00222                                         values.append( value )  
00223 
00224                         self.chart.setValues( values )
00225                         # Ensure all labels are strings
00226                         self.chart.setLabels( [unicode(x) for x in labels] )
00227                         # Ensure all categories are strings
00228                         self.chart.setCategories( [unicode(x) for x in categories] )
